Text: “The Most Incredible Thing" (Danish: "Det Utroligste" ) is a literary fairy tale by Danish poet and author Hans Christian Andersen (1805–1875).
Triplets:<Hans Christian Andersen
1:
<Text: The Most Incredible Thing:  The story is about a contest to find the most incredible thing and the wondrous consequences when the winner is chosen.>

Text: The Most Incredible Thing:  The tale was first published in an English translation by Horace Scudder, an American correspondent of Andersen's, in the United States in September 1870 before being published in the original Danish in Denmark in October 1870.
